snippet: Argentina’s Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that Marcelo Diez, who has required life support for two decades, can be allowed to die.
abstract: Argentina's Supreme Court issues ruling supporting right of Marcelo Diez, patient on life support since 1994, to die; landmark ruling upholds Argentina's 2012 death with dignity law.
lead_paragraph: Argentina’s Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that Marcelo Diez, who has required life support for two decades, can be allowed to die.

headline.main: Argentina: Top Court Rules for Family of Patient in a Right-to-Die Case
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Argentina: Top Court Rules for Family of Patient in a Right-to-Die Case
